Reviews.Title: “credit card fraud”
Reviews.Author: daniel c
Reviews.Content: i stayed in hotel rubino for a week during my mid leave from afghanistan. I payed at the counter using my visa debit card (this was the first and only time i have ever used this card). Once i returned to Australia i found that i was missing $50,000 from my account. I got a copy of my transactions and this is currently under investigation. I have never given out my bank details online nor did i use my ATM card overseas. I guess i cant proove it was them, but its just a bit suspicious that the transactions started five days after i left the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for a hotel in Rome city centre”
Reviews.Author: scorpiomma
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 2 nights. It is located very conveniently - close to the train station, so you don't have to walk too much with your luggage. At the same time you are in the city centre and all the sightseeing attractions are in walkable distance. The entrance to the hotel is a bit dodgy and confusing. There are few hotels in the building - like one floor - one hotel, but the room itself was clean. We didn't have any special view - the window was inside the courtyard which made the room quite, so it was ok. the strange thing is that the sink is not in the bathroom, but in the room - a bit unusual. In the bathroom there is a toilet and the shower which is quite small. the breakfast is included in the price of the hotel, but it is not served in the hotel itself - you get the ticket in the hotel and get your breakfast in a cafe across the street - the croissant and juice/tea/coffee. The pastry was very good, but the drink was nothing special (you'd better pay separately for a good espresso in some local place nearby).

Reviews.Title: “Worst HOTEL ever”
Reviews.Author: juskicknit36
Reviews.Content: This Hotel was Horriable! As soon as we showed up the two Asian lady workers were really really rude. That was until they broke a bottle of my cologne. Then they were at my finger tips. They bought me a new bottle and were rude again. Every Morning we woke up and the bathroom leaked a nasty pi$$ smelling water. I would NOT RECOMMEND THIS HOTEL TO ANYONE. I live here in Italy and it was my second time in rome. There are way more other hotels at a cheaper price with better service. HOTEL ROBINO can EAT A ... you know what...this site wont let me say it.

Reviews.Title: “TERRIBLE in fact the WORST hotel that I HAVE ever stayed in my entire life!”
Reviews.Author: Winstonng
Reviews.Content: Hotel lights were dim (in fact dimmest that I have ever encountered). I was being transfered from Hotel Soggiorno Blu as they said there was something wrong with the toilets as it were leaking. (However, Hotel Soggiorno Blu wasn't good either). There was a loud knocking on our hotel room in the middle of the night, but there were no peep holes, didn't dare open the doors as it wasn't safe at night. Found BED BUGS on the bed. Not ONE but A FEW!!! Toilet sucked big time, wasn't at all clean, sink was located near de bed. Wasn't clean either. Breakfast was served in a cafe opposite the road. However, one was allowed to have only one serving. There wasn't any staff at the reception AT ALL TIMES. Location is good though. Terrible hotel that one should take note the most when visiting Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Health Hazard”
Reviews.Author: rogmurf
Reviews.Content: In faireness the location for us was perfect, short walk from the Central Station - BUT - the "hotel" was a flea-pit literally - we found bugs on the sheets, and both my daughter and I caught bed-bugs and had to fumigate our home on return! Cupboards were all sagging and warping doors would not close, mildew in the bathroom and beds were lumpy. It should have NO Stars and i am very angry at the misrepresentation of its star rating, the Italian Authorites need to control these facilities much better Roger Turks & Caicos Islands

Reviews.Title: “the worst hotel on the planet”
Reviews.Author: goidellick
Reviews.Content: In brief - On arrival room was unready, we were told to return 4 hours later! This was not good with a young family. Wish we hadn't returned as we had a room with broken air con and 4 beds crawling in bed bugs. We were moved for our second night to a double room where they'd crammed 4 beds in, one being an inflatable bed and the other a camp bed! We were unable to use cupboards as the doors were jammed shut with the beds. We had to stack our luggage and could only get about by walking on the beds. We have travelled in Africa, Asia, S. America all in budget hotels and this is by far the worst!

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good budget stay”
Reviews.Author: superjamielol
Reviews.Content: For a two-star hotel I was actually expecting alot worse. I had to swap some bulbs around as the bedside lamp had blown and use my screwdriver to stop the showerhead falling off the wall, but otherwise this was a clean and comfortable stay. The thin walls can carry noise if other guests are being rowdy and you can forget sleeping in after 9am thanks to Rome's traffic. The wifi is up on the 5th floor, this hotel is on the 2nd floor, even if you get signal it's 5 euros for 5 hours. It's in a pretty good spot, only a block from Termini (central station) so getting around is not a problem. Lots of cheap dodgy eats around, though if you walk to the other side of the train station the quality of restaurants improves immensely. Close to several internet cafes and laundrettes. Watch out if you go a few more blocks to the north-east, that seems like a potentially unsafe area. Stick to the regular tourist zones. The check-in staff were accommodating if not a little abrupt, and the housekeepers were friendly and helpful. Despite the small problems the room had, I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “The difference between Hotel Rubino and sleeping on the street? 120 Euros.”
Reviews.Author: 407Steve
Reviews.Content: I am struggling to determine if, in 40 years of international travel, I have ever had a worse experience. As of this moment, I cannot think of any. The help was surly, argumentative and petty. The room had furniture that you could not give away. The Internet (5 Euros for 90 minutes) could not be received by our computers. You had to be buzzed-in past security glass to get in the place. It reminded me of places that "ladies of the night" utilize. You are greeted by graffiti and garbage in the elevator well. (I stayed only because they had my credit card number, I had been up for 30 hours without sleep, it was 11 p.m., and it was raining.) We had to trudge up two flights of stairs to a door in an elevator well that said "Hotel Rubino". To get in, you had to push a button on an intercom to get in the door. When we were finally given our room, it was actually at the "Hotel Planet", in the same building, 3 floors up. They are apparently allowned by the same people, as the "help" (if you could call it that) seemed to work in several hotels simultaneously. Our "view" was of a garbage-filled alleyway between buildings. We got a 4-bed room. It was actually a very small double room with two other beds wedged into the room. You almost had to step over beds to get to the bathroom. In the bathroom, there was a moldy water pitcher. When we left in the morning (as soon as we could), there was another group arguing vociferously with the "help" about the cleanliness of their room. They had actually put large dust-balls in a plastic bag to prove how gross the room was. Yet, the "help" was arguing loudly! It was a black comedy! Go to the other side of the Termini for rooms, preferably about 3 blocks. We found a room at the "Hotel Romantica", which was cheaper, clean, and attractive. Otherwise, unless it's raining, sleep on the ground inside the Termini. It's cleaner, and people are likely nicer. Did I mention that one of the mattresses fell through the springs, and as we were leaving another bed frame collapsed on my wife's toes?

Reviews.Title: “Don't even think about it!”
Reviews.Author: ChrisBrewer
Reviews.Content: The only thing going for this place is that it is cheap. We stayed for one night and that was more than enough. There were other hotels in the same street that were better and less money. Biggest moan was that although I had booked and reserved the room on a credit card they demanded payment in cash up front. As this was the last day of our trip, this meant changing more pounds into euros just to pay for the hotel. The place is a dump, it's dirty and a very unsafe place. No one on duty at the reception most of the time, certainly not in the evening. We were told to get breakfast (which we had paid for) at a cafe opposite and on arrival there in the morning were told they knew nothing about it. I can only be greatful that we were only there for one night.

Reviews.Title: “Please Do Not Stay Here, Warning!”
Reviews.Author: ewill30
Reviews.Content: This is not a hotel it is rent-a-room by the hour, if that. We stayed there one night, thankfully. There was hair in the bed, the comforter had all kinds of stains on it, and the shower curtain was old, moldy and looked like it hadn't been replaced in years. The shower walls had black mildew between the tiles, there were cracks in the walls, the paint was chipped and the front stoop leading to the bathroom was missing/broken. The hotel was inside a residential building which had graffiti on the walls and inside the elevator. The stairs leading to the rooms hadn't been cleaned; they were covered with hair and dirt. They were charging for the internet, it’s not free. We would not stay there for free!! Don’t stay here. They go by the names of hotel Planet and hotel Milazzo. Beware don't do it! Worst hotel, worst experience ever my husband asked me to kill him if he fell in the shower, death would be easier to bear. We took a shower with slippers on and left the curtain open, we did not dare to touch it. No joke! They should not offer this place on travel websites, it is a con job! Please burn your money rather than spending it on this hotel. Don’t even think about bringing kids to this place, they will catch something. It’s not even fit for homeless people, they are better off on the street.

Reviews.Title: “I wouldn't even recommend this hotel to my worst enemy!”
Reviews.Author: MinnieG
Reviews.Content: One night at this dreadful hotel was one night too many, I could have cried on entering the "reception area" let alone the bedroom. This had been booked in good faith by our friend (14 of us on a much awaited trip) who had been guided by the photo's shown on the hotel website along with the list of facilities. Half of the rooms were not ready, even though they had been booked two months earlier, I sat in one of the two chairs in reception and was left with something quite wet & disgusting clinging to my hand. The bedroom was dark, dirty and shabbily furnished. The bed sheets had what looked like moth holes, the shower curtain was covered in mould. The bathroom was so tiny that once you sat on the loo, you could wash your hands in the sink & your feet in the shower, all at the same time! The dressing table unit was chewed at one end and the drawers had telephone numbers, names etc., beautifully scrawled inside in felt pen, giving it the appearance of an old school desk.... ! Breakfast consisted of a scrap of paper to attend a "bar" across the road for a croissant & coffee, with standing room only to consume it.....outside....... luckily the weather was quite pleasant. All of this for the sum of 100 euros per night....what a rip off. Our first night was paid in advance, but by 8 am the next morning staff were phoning our rooms demanding payment in cash for the following 3 nights. Needless to say, our mass exodus of this disgusting hotel promptly took place before 10 am. Hotel Aphrodite, which is literally around the corner quickly made arrangements to accommodate all 14 of us at very short notice....for 85 euros per night for double room/breakfast. This hotel had lovely clean, well equipped and furnished rooms, which included mini bars, satellite tv, hairdryers etc., The staff were fantastic, attentive & extremely helpful and their continental buffet style breakfast in their roof top dining room was lovely. In conclusion, Hotel RUBINO should be reported for false representation. It is obvious that we were not the only people to be hoodwinked into parting with a substantial amount of money. We were fortunate that our friend was "switched on" and we didn't meet their demands and pay up front for the remaining 3 nights. Nevertheless they "made" 700 euros from our party on that one night. I felt so sorry for our friend, who had gone to so much trouble to arrange this trip for us as he felt responsible. If you were on an extremely tight budge, shabby could be accepted for a much,much lower price, but dirty and shabby for 100 euros a night.........never.

Reviews.Title: “BEWARE! DO NOT STAY HERE.”
Reviews.Author: augustus1
Reviews.Content: Stay away from here. It's disgusting. I took a party of 14 to Rome for a 4 day cultural tour. We paid the first nights fee in advance by credit card, Fair enough, one would expect that. Upon our arrival they demanded cash in full for the remaining three nights, Tgey stated that they would not accept credit card payments. The rooms were filthy. The showers were broken, the beds were stained and the place was infested with incects. The rooms bore no resemblance to those shown on the website. Further, you get a ticket for breakfast and then you go to a local cafe where you get a breadroll and a cup of coffee. Value 1.5 Euros. You even have to stand up, it's so crowded. At 8.00am after our first night, they were ringing each room up demanding payment for the next 3 nights. This place is a dump. I'm reporting them to the Italian Tourist Board, and we have taken photos of this 'Doss House''. Everything on their website is a false representation as to what you will actually get. Rome is a great city to visit, but a visit here would ruin it. We moved out en-mass. I could see that the receptionist was not suprised. This is obviously a regular event. I could see that she was embarrased. We went to the nearby Hotel Aphrodite. 15 euros a night cheaper, 3 star, clean and modern with a substantial breakfast, taken in an area with access to a roof garden. The hotel RUBINO was truely the worst hotel that I have stayed in, in the whole of Europe. Stay away. You've been warned!

Reviews.Title: “THE WORST HOTEL ON THE PLANET!”
Reviews.Author: romanmonkey
Reviews.Content: Disgrace!!! Efforts will be made to get this place shut down. It is a health risk, a fire risk and a personal safety risk. Please do not book or even walk into this place, just look in the elevator, it'll convince you not to stay. For 85 euro less you can stay 100 yards away in a 3 or 4 star hotel. Please don't make the mistake we did and part with your money to this [--] hole.

Reviews.Title: “Find somewhere else - lots of choice nearby”
Reviews.Author: Disabledsightseer
Reviews.Content: Booked for several nights but on arrival rooms not ready and place dirty, air conditioning not working, bathrooms dirty, some beds also dirty and shabby and we were asked to pay the remainder in cash later that day. All rooms and bathrooms where the same and we were charged 100 euros per night. Breakfast the next day was a croissant and a coffee at the coffee bar across the road paid for with a 1.50 euro voucher from the hotel but don't expect to sit down to eat or stay long! All our party were contacted to pay the bill in cash straight away. After the first night we all moved to The Aphrodite - just round the corner - 85 Euros a night, clean rooms and bathrooms and a breakfast in the hotel restaurant - go there instead! If you booked & paid you're deposit by credit card then 'phone & cancel your card if you leave early - just in case!

Reviews.Title: “worst hotel i've been in!”
Reviews.Author: meme014
Reviews.Content: It was not stated when booking that the hotel was on a second floor. the bathroom was tiny and smelt due to poor ventilation. the bathroom walls had old soap marks on them. the double bed was 2 single mattresses pushed together hence my husband and i had to keep pushing the foams together as they kept separating in the middle (and i had my 17months old baby with me.) Breakfast was extremely poor and outside the hotel- other hotels have a proper buffet and meals are indoors. also we waited a good many mins before the receptionist came to attaned to us even though we had buzzed in and they knew of our arrival. also we came back from a trip on sunday to find out that the room had not been tidied. when someone came, the room was still not swept. Wet towels were dried on the chair instead of been replaced (once). when asked, i was told the AC unit was broken- well then maybe we should bot have been given that room. Other than for the location, i would not recommend this hotel to anymore.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely awful, no electricity but was still charged”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We arrived at Hotel Rubino at 1am, we'd booked a double room with shared bathroom which ended up being in a completely separate building. We arrived to find no electricity and climbed the stairs to the room in complete darkness. This was probably just as well as the room looked awful even in the dark. I'd already been asked to pay in cash, despite booking on a credit card, which I was eventually given back when it was clear the problem was not going to be fixed and a kind member of staff helped us find another hotel. However, I arrived home to find the money for the room had still been taken from my credit card. Numerous emails have been sent regarding this but there has been no reply. Needless to say I wuold not recommend staying at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Look elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: PWesel
Reviews.Content: I chose Hotel Rubino for a one-night stopover on my way from Florence to the Rome Airport because it was (relatively) inexpensive and very close to the Termini railway station. Big mistake. When my family of 6 arrived, we were informed that the air conditioning system was broken, and that they were transferring us to Hotel Ploanet around the corner (this was after we had toted our luggage up four flights of stairs in 90 degree heat). We brought our baggage down again, and walked the two blocks to Hotel Planet. Except it wasn't Hotel Planet, it was Hotel Blu. Our heads, at this point, were spinning. What hotel were we staying in? The neighborhood is more than just a bit downscale. It is, literally, on the wrong side of the tracks. Seedy characters, night-time sleaze of all kinds, an off-putting smell. We were happy to leave in the morning. I would not recommend any of the hotels in this group to anyone. Look at a map of Rome. Do not stay on that side of the Termini. Hotels on the other side may cost 10-15 euros more, but if you can afford that difference, I say it's worth it. -p.w. boston, massachusetts

Reviews.Title: “Dirtiest hotel in....the planet! No joke!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The most horrible hotel experience of my life......during our honeymoon we walk into the room and the floor is filthy, there is stains on the wall, there is mold and paint peeling on the ceiling of the shower, the bed is broken, the tv remote doesnt work, the shower head is broken and sprays water into light fixtures.....health hazard, safety hazard, tiny dirty room.....the hotel is not a traditional hotel, it is actually a single floor in a building complex....the breakfast is stale bread and butter/marmalade....to top it all off the staff at the hotel could not care less about anything and are rude without exception......enjoy the pictures and stay away from hotel planet (aka hotel rubino!!)!!

Reviews.Title: “Smelly”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Smelly, with rodants crawling in room. Bathroom is that small that you can't even swing a cat in it. If you are a plus size person, don't even attempt having a shower unless you like the idea of one foot in the toilet and another out the window. That's how small the shower is. Could not wait to get out of that place.

HotelInfo.Name: Rubino
HotelInfo.Address: Via Milazzo, 3, 00185 Rome, Italy
